Metered Pay-by-Plate Find information on rates, times, and locations. Mobile App Information on a touchless way to pay. Permit Parking Locations Beach permit & Boat Ramp permit info. Disabled Parking Info on parking and how to get the first 4 hours free. Parking Citation Online payment portal and information. Parking Map Map of parking locations. The Parking Division maintains forty-seven (47) multi-space parking meters throughout the City of Deerfield Beach. The meters are strategically placed covering 573 off-street parking spaces and 336 on-street parking spaces. Additionally, there are 497 non-metered spaces at The Cove Shopping Complex and an additional 202 non-metered parking spaces at the Palm Plaza Shopping Center. The City of Deerfield Beach has partnered with FPL to install electric vehicle charging stations at the Main Beach parking lot. Six vehicles can charge at once, and the charging is free to the users. Users must still follow all rules for parking at the beach, including pulling in forward and paying to park. Metered Pay-by-Plate The City of Deerfield Beach has implemented a Pay-by-Plate parking system. This system uses License Plate Recognition (LPR) technology. Simply enter your vehicle license plate number at one of the multi-space parking meters strategically located throughout the City. A Parking Enforcement Specialist with the Broward County Sheriff's Office, will scan the license plate using LPR technology to confirm payment of the patron's parking session. Payments The meters accept Visa, MasterCard, Discover, American Express, and coins. When paying with coins the hour must be completed. Certain meters do accept mixed payments (coins + credit card). View Full-Sized Map here Parking Rates Parking Regulations are enforced 24/7, including weekends and holidays. If you park in an area after the designated times noted, a parking citation will be issued. Each citation for parking beyond the designated time frame carries a $30.00 fine. LOCATION PARKING ALLOWED DURING THESE HOURS RATE Pier Parking Lot Monday from 6 AM to Friday at 4 PM $3.00/Hour Pier Parking Lot Friday from 4 PM to Midnight on Sunday $4.00/Hour Kirk Cottrell Pavilion Monday from 6 AM to Friday at 4 PM $3.00/Hour Kirk Cottrell Pavilion Friday from 4 PM to Midnight on Sunday $4.00/Hour Pioneer Park Boat Ramp 24/7 $1.00/Hour Everywhere Else Monday from 6 AM to Friday at 4 PM $2.00/Hour Everywhere Else Friday from 4 PM to Midnight on Sunday $3.00/Hour BACK TO TOP Parkmobile Mobile App The City of Deerfield Beach has partnered with ParkMobile , a smartphone app that provides a touchless option for parking payments. Now there is no need to run back to the meter, or search for coins – use ParkMobile instead! The app is available for download on iPhone and Android . How To Use parkmobile Download the app on iPhone or Android and complete the registration process, including your plate number, credit card information, and alerts. Pay for parking using the correct zone. You can find your zone by using the street signs behind the parking meter, entering the zone number in the search bar, or panning the map. Zone 8501 - Kirk Cottrell Pavilion Lot Zone 8502 - Pier Parking Lot Zone 8503 - Hillsboro/Fire Station Lot & Areas Zone 8504 - Main/South Beach Lot & Areas Zone 8505 - South of SE 4 Street & West of A1A Zone 8506 - Pioneer Park/Boat Ramp Zone 8507 - Sullivan Park Zone 8508 - Boat Slip at Sullivan Park Once you paid for parking, you will be able to see a countdown on your screen and receive a reminder ( create in settings ) when your time is about to expire. With a simple click, you can extend your time. If you originally paid for parking at a metered pay-by-plate machine, and it's about to expire, you can start a new session by using the ParkMobile mobile app. Parking Enforcement Specialists will use your license plate number to verify that you have paid for parking. ***Please Note: There is a 70¢ convenience charge for every ParkMobile transaction. BACK TO TOP Permit Parking Locations The Residential Digital Parking Permit is valid ONLY at the four (4) locations listed below. Parking spaces are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. If you occupy an on-street parking space, you will be required to pay for your parking session at one of the multi-space parking meters or from the ParkMobile app. Failure to do so will result in a parking citation that carries a fine amount of $30.00 . Please note: During special events, permit parking will not be available in certain areas. Residents can purchase their annual parking permit online . RESIDENTIAL Beach Parking Permit PARKING LOT NAME PARKING LOT LOCATION PARKMOBILE ZONE South Beach 2025 SE 9th Street (across from Embassy Suites) 8504 Main Beach 149 SE 21 Avenue (between SE 1 Street & SE 2 Street) 8504 Fire Station 2040 SE 1 Street (behind Fire Station #75) 8503 Hillsboro 2048 E. Hillsboro Blvd (adjacent to the Fire Station Lot) 8503 Boat Trailer Parking PERMIT PARKING LOT NAME PARKING LOT LOCATION PARKMOBILE  ZONE Pioneer Park Boat Ramp Pioneer Park 8506 BACK TO TOP Disabled Parking Individuals occupying a designated disabled parking space must visibly display the disabled placard from the rearview mirror for the entire duration of their parking session. Failure to visibly display the disabled placard will result in a parking citation that carries a fine amount of $250.00 . Individuals occupying a non-designated parking space must register the vehicle license plate at one of the multi-space parking meters. The maximum number of complimentary hours allowed is four (4). Anyone exceeding the four (4) complimentary hours will be required to pay the prevailing parking rates. Failure to register the license plate will result in a parking citation that carries a fine amount of $30.00 . Disabled spaces are available on a first-come, first-serve basis . *Please note: Four (4) hours of complimentary parking in non-designated parking spaces is ONLY available with on-street parking spaces. Complimentary parking is not available in any parking lot. Registering License Plate in Meter Visibly hang the D isabled Placard from the rear-view mirror. Proceed to the nearest multi-space parking meter or use the ParkMobile mobile app. If using a multi-space parking meter, select the blue DISABLED PARKING option. Enter your vehicle license plate number. Confirm the license plate number by pressing NEXT. To correct the license plate number press BACK. You will get a receipt indicating you have four (4) hours of complimentary parking. If you do not get a receipt, you need to start over. NO RECEIPT = NO TRANSACTION **Please note: If you are located in a designated disabled space, you do not have to register.  However, if you are parked in a NON-handicap space in a parking lot, you must pay the prevailing parking rates. The registration above refers only to on-street parking. ***Exceptions: vehicles equipped with foot/hand controls, ramps, 'DV' (disabled veteran) tag or Florida toll exemption permit. F.S.S. 316.1964(8). BACK TO TOP Parking Citation Pay your citation online . To request an Administrative Review of your parking citation, a written appeal shall be submitted to the Parking Enforcement Office located at 580 South Powerline Rd, Deerfield Beach, Florida, 33442. The written appeal must be received by the Parking Enforcement office within ten (10) calendar days from the date of the citation. You can view your citation and related pictures online . Download a copy of the Request for Administrative Review form Download a copy of the Request for Magistrate Hearing form Failure to pay the parking citation or timely submitting an appeal will result in late fees and potential collection agency fees. All unpaid parking citations are referred to a 3rd party collection agency at 60-days. An additional add-on fee is applied to all parking citations assigned to the collection agency. For information regarding parking citations please contact the Deerfield Beach Parking Authority at 954.480.4499 or via email at: web.parking@deerfield-beach.com . Towing In accordance with Sec. 66-44 of the City's Code of Ordinances, vehicles are subject to towing if the registered owner has failed to: pay the fines and penalties resulting from the parking citations; or pay the fines and penalties resulting from the loss of an appeal All towing within Deerfield Beach city limits is performed by: Emerald Towing 4000 North Powerline Road 800-239-0604 Applicable towing, storage, administrative fees shall be paid prior to releasing the vehicle. BACK TO TOP Contact Us Parking Division Deerfield Beach West Community Center 580 South Powerline Road Pay-by-Plate Contact 954-480-4256 Citations 954-480-4499 Email Address web.parking@deerfield-beach.com FAQs What are the parking rates? The parking rates vary in the different zones but the multi-space parking meter will always indicate the prevailing rate for the zone in which you have chosen to park. Kirk Cottrell Pavilion ( Zone 8501 ) Monday from 6 AM to Friday 4 PM $3.00/Hour Kirk Cottrell Pavilion Friday 4 PM to Midnight (12am) on Sunday $4.00/Hour Fishing Pier Parking Lot ( Zone 8502 ) Monday from 6 AM to Friday 4 PM $3.00/Hour Friday 4 PM to Midnight (12am) on Sunday $4.00/Hou r The remainder of Barrier Island (beach) ( Zones 8503-8504-8505 ) Monday from 6 AM to Friday 4 PM $2.00/Hour Friday 4 PM to Midnight (12am) on Sunday $3.00/Hour Pioneer Park Boat Ramp (24/7) ( Zone 8506 ) $1.00/Hou r When are Pay-by-Plate metered locations enforced? Parking areas north of SE 1 Street and along Ocean Way, are enforced every day of the week from 6 AM until 12 midnight. ( this includes the Kirk Cottrell Pavilion parking lot and the Pier parking lot) Parking areas south of SE 1 Street and along Ocean Way, are enforced every day of the week from 6 AM until 11 PM. ( this includes the Main beach parking lot ). The parking lot west of A1A and east SE 19 Avenue between SE 5 Street and SE 6 Street closes at 7 PM. Do Pay Stations accept payment after enforcement hours? No. Pay Stations are pro-rated and will not accept payments that exceed the time period for that specific location. Pay Stations are also programmed to shut off after the enforced time period. Can you pay with Credit Cards? Yes. The multi-space parking meters accept Visa, Mastercard, American Express and Discover. Is a receipt issued? Yes. Once the transaction is completed a receipt is issued. However, if a receipt is not issued, the transaction was not completed and you will be required to start the process over. Do you need to place the receipt on your dashboard? No. The City’s Parking Enforcement Division uses License Plate Recognition technology (LPR)  to identified those who paid for parking as well as those who didn’t pay for parking. The receipt serves as proof that a parking session was paid for. It also provides the time the parking session expires. There is no need to place the receipt on the dashboard. Keep it for your records only. How do you add time to the meter? Simply press the one hour button until desired time is reached. Parking rates are per hour. For added convenience, you may also use the Way-To-Park app to add or extend your parking session. ***Reminder: Deerfield Beach only accepts the ‘WAY-TO-PARK’ app. Do individuals with a disability get free parking? When occupying a designated handicap parking space, individuals owning a valid, current handicap placard can park for free for the duration of the designated time frame. In ZONE 8503 the designated time frame is until 12 midnight In ZONE 8504 the designated time frame is until 11 pm. The handicap placard shall be visibly displayed for the ENTRE duration of the parking session. Individuals occupying a non-designated parking space shall receive the FIRST 4 HOURS of parking at no charge. To qualify, the individual shall register their license plate at one of the multi-space pay stations strategically located throughout the Barrier Island. Failure to register shall render the parking session as unpaid and in violation of Ordinance 66-77; which carries a fine amount of $30.00. The 4-hours of complimentary parking applies ONLY to on-street parking. Complimentary parking is NOT available on any o ff-street parking lot. Are the meter screens lit in the evening? Yes. When any button is pressed the screen will light up for the duration of the transaction. Does the meter accept mixed payments, for example, coins and credit cards? Yes. If a license plate number is entered incorrectly, can it be corrected? Yes. Before your transaction is completed you can either use the backspace key to make corrections or cancel the entire transaction by pressing the red “X” button and start over. Can a ticket be appealed? Yes. In accordance with Sec. 66-41(d); any person may submit within ten (10) calendar days a written request with the City’s Parking Division for review of the parking citation. The written appeal must be received by the Parking Division within ten (10) calendar days or the right to appeal is forfeited. An Administrative Review of the parking citation shall be a precedent to filing an appeal with the Special Magistrate. All requests shall be mailed or hand delivered to: Parking Enforcement Office 150 NE Second Ave Deerfield Beach, FL  33441 You can view your parking citation and related pictures at www.dfb.city/paymyticket. ***Please note: failure to pay a parking citation will result in late fees. /FAQ.aspx Digital Parking Permit Disabled Parking Metered Pay-By-Plate ParkMobile App Parking Citations Parking Map Permit Parking Locations Contact Us 150 NE 2nd Avenue Deerfield Beach, FL 33441 Phone: 954-480-4200 AFTER HOURS WATER/SEWER 954-480-4371 & 954-480-4373 Department Phone Numbers Quick Links Bid/RFQ Postings Budget Contact Us Current City Projects Parks Map Pay Bills Special Events /QuickLinks.aspx Site Links Home Centennial Media Center Accessibility Copyright Notices /QuickLinks.aspx Loading Loading Do Not Show Again Close Arrow Left Arrow Right [] Slideshow Left Arrow Slideshow Right Arrow

Building Services | Deerfield Beach, FL - Official Website Skip to Main Content Search Centennial Business Departments Residents Government Visitors Home Departments Building Services A A Building Services The Building Division is responsible for enforcing codes and ordinances ensuring safe, sound, and progressive development of commercial and residential properties. Renovations, remodeling, and construction are all closely monitored, while code inspections are conducted systematically. The division complies with guidelines established by the Florida Building Commission and Broward County Board of Rules & Appeals and is responsible for the identification and removal of unsafe structures in conjunction with the Unsafe Structure Board. The division also provides plan review, permits, and periodic inspection services to most public and private construction as determined by the Florida Building Code and other applicable laws. BUILDING APPS & FORMS ONLINE PAYMENT Link and instructions. ONLINE PERMIT STATUS INSPECTION SCHEDULING BUILDING PUBLIC RECORDS Submit New Public Record requests & track status. CONDO PERMIT REQUIREMENTS STAFF CONTACTS PERMIT & INSPECTION REPORT BROWARD COUNTY ePERMITS Asbestos Cert, TCEA, & NOC online to Broward. ONLINE SUBMITTAL Only accepting AC Change outs, Water Heaters, Panel Replacements and Re-roofs online. How to Make an Online Payment Visit the online payments Online Payment For Building Permits and follow the steps below. Step 1 - click on "Make a Payment" Step 2 - On the Make a Payment window, enter the Application Number and click "Find". Step 3 - Select the application by clicking the checkmark in the results and you will see a list of fees associated with the application number. Confirm the fees and then click "Checkout." On the screens that follow, enter payment information and complete the transaction. transaction fee Effective February 1, 2023, a transaction fee will be applied to payments made specifically by checking account, credit card, charge card, bank debit card, and auto pay (using a debit/credit card). These fees apply to payments made online, but not in person at the City cashier located at City Hall. If a payment is made online, you will see two separate transactions. One will be for the payment to the City of Deerfield Beach and the other will be for the transaction fee. The transaction provider for the City of Deerfield Beach is Paymentus. For additional information, please visit the City of Deerfield Beach website link here: https://www.deerfield-beach.com/2141/TRANSACTION-Fees BACK TO TOP Schedule Inspections An inspection can be scheduled by phone or by a form that will be emailed to us and should be in no later than 3 PM for the next business day. 954-571-4504 Form Submission The required information is needed to schedule an inspection: Permit or application number Discipline in which you wish to schedule The exact inspection you are requesting (found on the inside of your permit card) The date that you would like the inspection to occur. Contact information in case we have any questions Please note that if you are scheduling for the next business day, your request must be in no later than 3 PM. BACK TO TOP Condo Permit Requirements We all want to have a better place to live and would love to improve our units. It is important to remember that Florida Building Code does not allow an owner of a Condo to do work on his unit. Also, a Florida Licensed Contractor must be hired, and a permit must be obtained prior to allowing any contractor to start work. Failure to hire a licensed contractor is a felony in the state of Florida “Florida Statute 489.127(1) (f)”. Permits are required for almost any work in your unit. Exceptions are interior painting and replacing floor covering, which may have some requirements implemented by your association to comply with State regulations about noise transmittal. Here are some common examples of work that is typically performed by Condo owners that require a permit and a licensed contractor: water heaters replacing air‐conditioning units renovation for kitchens or bathrooms replacing bathtubs or showers replacing windows or doors installing hurricane shutters replacing any balcony enclosures with screen/ acrylic windows enclosing balconies with windows to add a new room (which is an addition) adding light fixtures or electric fan connection mold remediation works Submittal of the DFB HOA Affidavit is required for all residential permits. After obtaining a permit from the Building department and prior to commencing work, the permit card must be displayed on the front of your unit (visible from the outside), during the progress of work until the permit is closed (Final inspection signed on the permit card in your possession). Original permit documents must be available at the time of inspections. Once your contractor has applied for a permit you can view information about the permit fees, payments, application, inspection results, permit status Online Payment For Building Permits [still open (AP) / expired (EX), or Closed (CL)] prior to final payment to your contractor. Deerfield Beach Building Department 150 NE 2 Avenue Deerfield Beach, FL 33441 954-480-4250 BACK TO TOP Online Permit Submittal The City of Deerfield Beach Building Department is continuously making efforts to provide the public with exceptional solutions and will now be accepting digital email submittal of: residential permits for re-roofs residential water heater replacements residential air conditioning replacements residential electrical panel/service changes In order to utilize this service, you must be a registered contractor with the City of Deerfield Beach. If your information is not up to date or you are not registered with the City, please attach the required information along with your application packet. NOTE: All information must be either typed or neatly printed. Incomplete packets WILL NOT be processed. Residential Re-Roof Requirements Listed below are the requirements for re-roof permits submitted online: Complete Permit Application . Please make sure accurate job cost and notarized signatures of BOTH the qualifier AND property owner are included. Complete Roofing Package Product Approvals Manufacturing Specs DFB HOA Affidavit Notice of Commencement if job costs exceed $5000 Print out the Roofing Package and Permit Application , scan all required info, and email one PDF file. Residential Water Heater Replacement Requirements Listed below are the requirements for water heater replacement permits submitted online: Complete Permit Application . Please make sure accurate job cost, gallon capacity of the tank, and notarized signature of BOTH the qualifier and property owner are included. Water Heater Replacement Form DFB HOA Affidavit Notice of Commencement if job costs exceed $5000 Print out Water Heater Replacement Form and Permit Application , scan all of the required information, and email one PDF file to DBOnline@cgasolutions.com . Residential A/C Replacement Requirements Listed below are the requirements for A/C replacement permits submitted online: Complete Permit Application . Please make sure accurate job cost, gallon capacity of the tank, and notarized signature of BOTH the qualifier and property owner are included. A/C Data Sheet Verification of the equipment's efficiency (AHRI) Anchoring details if applicable (required for commercial replacements) DFB HOA Affidavit Notice of Commencement if job costs exceed $15,000 Print out the A/C Data Sheet and Permit Application, scan all of the required information, and email one PDF file. Residential Electrical Panel/Service Change Requirements Listed below are the requirements for panel/service change permits submitted online: Complete Permit Application . Please make sure accurate job cost, gallon capacity of the tank, and notarized signature of BOTH the qualifier and property owner are included. Electrical Plan (if NOT an EXACT replacement) DFB HOA Affidavit Print out the Permit Application , scan all of the required information, and email one PDF file. Applications are processed in the order received. The Deerfield Beach Building Department will make every effort to issue your permit in a timely manner. Once completed, payment is required and can be made online or in-person at the cashier. Please notify us via email at dbonline@cgasolutions.com once the payment has been made. You will then be emailed a validated copy of the permit. This copy, along with the original packet that was digitally submitted, must be on-site at the time of inspections. The City of Deerfield Beach and Broward County have teamed up to launch ePermitsOneStop, a centralized website that allows customers to submit their applications and have their plans reviewed online for permits, licenses, and approvals. Using ePermitsOneStop , Deerfield Beach customers can now apply and receive approval for both Deerfield Beach building permits and associated Broward County permits in a quicker, more seamless process, eliminating the need to travel to Broward's Government Center West in Plantation. Click below for step-by-step instructions for Asbestos Certificates, Transportation Concurrency & Environmental Review, Notice of Commencement, or for ePermitting phone support. How to Apply (ePermitsOneStop) Asbestos Certificate Transportation Concurrency & Environmental Review Notice of Commencement Broward Support Hotline Beginning May 3, 2021, ALL submittals for Development & Environmental Review projects in Broward County will only be accepted electronically through the ePermits website . Applicants will no longer be able to submit any plans for review in person per Broward County. Chris Baird Read Bio Chris Baird Chris is a seasoned leader with over 15 years of combined B2B sales and general management experience emphasizing Machine-to-Machine (M2M) and Internet of Things (IoT) industries. He currently serves as President and CEO of Graham Partners portfolio company, OptConnect, a one-stop-shop provider of managed wireless connectivity solutions. Chris also serves on Graham Partners’ Technology and Innovation Council. OptConnect, a Utah-based company, is one of North America’s leading managed service wireless connectivity providers and provides a secure and reliable monitored wireless connection to the internet for unattended equipment that is easy, low-risk, and convenient – all supported by superior customer service infrastructure. Today, OptConnect serves an ever-expanding list of industries and markets, including various applications within Retail and Payments, Cash Automation and Security, Agriculture, Industrial, and Energy, to name a few. Through Chris’ leadership and tenure, OptConnect’s exponential growth has landed the company on the Inc. 5000 list four years in a row. The company has also been named by Mountain West Capital Network to the “Utah 100” for a fifth time, making it one of the 100 fastest-growing companies in the state. Chris is also the recipient of the 2021 “CEO of the Year” award by Utah Business Magazine. Jeff Buss Read Bio Jeff Buss Jeff is a seasoned executive with a demonstrated record of building resilient, secure and profitable businesses. With over 30 years of experience, Jeff has held a variety of leadership roles in IT and cybersecurity, currently serving as the Chief Information Officer (CIO) for Dexian and on the advisory board of Unknown Cyber. He also serves on Graham Partners’ Technology and Innovation Council. Previously, Jeff served as Global CIO of Nordic Consulting, where he helped the firm double its revenue in just 30 months. At Nordic, he orchestrated the firm’s technology and security portfolio, built its cybersecurity consulting practice, and managed an industry-leading IT and cybersecurity team. During his tenure, he assisted in the acquisition of five businesses, as well as the ultimate sale of Nordic to a strategic buyer. Before Nordic, Jeff was a Managing Director at Ernst & Young, where he served as a cybersecurity advisor to four of the five largest banks in the U.S., ran two national practices, and led a global partnership with Splunk. He grew his team from 4 to 42 in 18 months and helped drive a significant increase in sales in less than 24 months. Early in his career, Jeff served as a Naval Flight Officer with carrier-based Electronic Attack Squadrons before shifting his focus to IT Operations and Cybersecurity. He operated and defended one of the largest global networks in the world – the Department of Defense Information Network (DODIN) – with over three million users, including the White House, before retiring as a Captain from the Navy. He also served as CTO for cyber development at the Defense Information Systems Agency and Deputy Director of the Center for Cybersecurity Studies at the U.S. Naval Academy. Steven Graham Chief Executive Officer and Senior Managing Partner Read Bio Steven Graham Chief Executive Officer and Senior Managing Partner Steve Graham founded Graham Partners in 1988. He serves as the firm’s CEO and Senior Managing Partner, and sits on the firm’s Buyout and Growth Investment Committees, the Buyout / Growth Valuation Committee, and the GCI Investment Committee. Steve oversees all the activities of the firm, including investment sourcing, evaluation, monitoring, and divestiture; as well as overseeing the firm’s operations group. Steve established the firm’s long-standing strategy of investing in conversion plays in advanced manufacturing and industrial technology, created its operations-centric focus and its operations team, and developed the broad investment themes and investment criteria that drive the firm’s sourcing and investment activities. Prior to founding Graham Partners, Steve worked for Goldman, Sachs & Co. in its Investment Banking Division, and for the RAF Group. For the first decade after founding Graham Partners, Steve and his team oversaw corporate finance activities relating to operating interests associated with The Graham Group, managing merger, acquisition, and joint venture transactions for The Graham Group that were completed in Italy, France, Canada, The United Kingdom, Poland, Brazil, and Argentina, as well as major financings and the divestiture of a controlling interest in Graham Packaging Company to a Blackstone Group-controlled fund in 1998. During this period, Steve served as a member of both the Investment Committee and Advisory Board of The Graham Group, as an Officer, Board member, and Management Committee member of numerous Graham Group operating and investment entities, and as the Graham family trustee for trusts that owned direct or indirect interests in various Graham Group entities, a role he continues to serve in today. Steve has formed numerous charitable entities and supports many philanthropic causes in education, sports, the arts, dance, and health care. Several of Steve’s initiatives are focused upon under-resourced youth, including academic scholarship programs in over ten schools in the Greater Philadelphia region, coupled with numerous programs domestically and internationally supporting youth in sports and dance. Steve also serves on the Advisory Boards of certain unaffiliated private investment funds managed by other general partners, and has in past years served on private equity-related advisory committees for both Dartmouth College’s Graduate School of Business (Tuck) and Williams College, as well as on the boards of certain private schools. Steve earned his B.A. from Williams College with a double major in Philosophy and English, and his M.B.A. from the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth College. While at Williams, Steve was a three-sport varsity athlete (tennis, track, and skiing), and captain of the downhill ski team. Steve is still active in skiing, tennis, and other sports today. Senior Firm Advisors Donald Graham Donald Graham Senior Firm Advisor Don is the founder of The Graham Group, an alliance of industrial businesses and investment management firms, each of which traces its roots to a design engineering firm founded in Central Pennsylvania by Don in 1960 in the basement of his York County farmhouse. The Graham Group’s three legacy industrial businesses, Graham Packaging, Graham Engineering , and Graham Architectural , operate globally and collectively generate several billion dollars in annual revenue. The Graham Group has also spawned multiple independent investment businesses, which today manage several billion dollars in internal capital for Graham and 3rd party capital for external institutional investors. Graham Capital is the internal investment office responsible for managing Graham family capital under an endowment-style, with a portfolio of investments in marketable securities and alternative investments. Graham Partners and Inverness Graham are independent Registered Investment Advisors managing committed capital under private equity structures for institutional investors. Additional private capital entities associated with the Graham family include GCI , Graham Sports & Entertainment Partners , Graham Software Development , Striker Partners and Frontline Healthcare Partners , which manage a combination of internal and external capital and make direct investments in a variety of sectors, including software development/information technology, healthcare, education, and sports. Don earned his bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering and a master’s degree in Industrial Engineering & Business Management from the University of Michigan, where he remains actively involved on a philanthropic and volunteer basis. Don was inducted into the University of Michigan Engineering Honorary Societies; Pi Tau Sigma and Sigma Rho Tau. Don has served on the President’s Advisory Group for four University Presidents, founded the University’s Graham Sustainability Institute and the Graham Graduate Entrepreneurial Studies Program, and has actively supported numerous programs across the University. He has also received Honorary Doctorate Degrees from both York College of Pennsylvania and the University of Michigan and is an Honorary Penn State Alumnus. A committed supporter of educational, community, cultural and environmental projects, Don has funded programs at many other institutions, including Dartmouth College, the University of Pennsylvania, York College of Pennsylvania, Pennsylvania State University, Babson College, Burke Mountain Academy, and YSC Academy. Don has been active in many professional groups, including the Young Presidents’ Organization, Chief Executives Organization, World Business Council, American Business Council, and the Recycling Advisory Council, as well as serving on numerous corporate and philanthropic boards. He received the Lifetime Achievement Award from the Society of Plastics Engineers (SPE), was inducted into the Plastics Hall of Fame and received the YPO Legends Award. Internationally, Don served as Chairman of the Trustees of the Mpala Wildlife Foundation in Kenya for over 15 years. Don is married with five children and seventeen grandchildren Thomas Hall Thomas Hall Senior Advisor Tom is a Senior Advisor with over 30 years of experience in all aspects of global business operations, procurement, strategic planning, financial management, personnel development and general management. Tom spent 25 years with Air Products & Chemicals, an international supplier of industrial gases and chemicals with annual sales of approximately $10 billion. Tom’s career at Air Products included roles in financial management, procurement, strategic planning, M&A, and business and operational management. He formerly ran a $1.7 billion global business unit of Air Products where he had full profit and loss accountability for the Chemicals Group’s three divisions spanning multiple continents. Tom has been heavily involved in the management of private equity owned companies since 2000. Throughout his career, both in public and private companies, Tom has routinely been assigned to leadership positions within business units that required substantial turnaround skills. In this capacity, Tom has accumulated substantial experience in cost management, cash and working capital management, price and margin improvement, personnel development and achieving sustained business growth. Tom’s past and present Graham board directorships include HB&G, Infiltrator, NDS, Schneller and The Atlas Group. Tom received his B.S. in Economics from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania, his M.B.A. from the University of Michigan and graduated from the Advanced Management Program at Harvard University. Peter Linneman Peter Linneman Senior Advisor Dr. Peter Linneman is the founding Principal of Linneman Associates, KL Realty and American Land Funds and is the Albert Sussman Emeritus Professor of Real Estate, Finance and Business Public Policy at the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania. He was a member of Wharton’s faculty for 35 years, founding Wharton’s Real Estate Department and the Zell-Lurie Real Estate Center. He is the founding co-editor of The Wharton Real Estate Review and has published over 100 articles during his career. Dr. Linneman is widely recognized as a leading strategic thinker and investor, and has been cited as one of the 25 most influential people in real estate by Realtor Magazine , as well as one of the 100 most powerful people in New York real estate by the New York Observer . He is a highly sought-after speaker, appearing as the keynote speaker at numerous major industry conferences. His quarterly research publication, The Linneman Letter , has been perhaps the most highly regarded publication in the real estate industry for over a decade. His book, Real Estate Finance and Investments: Risks and Opportunities , has been adopted at over 150 leading universities and is the leading primary reference source in real estate finance and investment. He has served as Senior Managing Director of Equity International Properties, Vice Chairman of Amerimar Realty and the Chairman of the Board of Rockefeller Center Properties. In this latter capacity, he led the process of foreclosing on its Japanese owners and the successful sale of Rockefeller Center in 1995. He also served on the board of directors of public and private companies. Dr. Linneman holds both Masters and Doctorate degrees in Economics from the University of Chicago. Office of the City Manager | Deerfield Beach, FL - Official Website Skip to Main Content Search Centennial Business Departments Residents Government Visitors Home Government Office of the City Manager A A Office of the City Manager Welcome to our great City located on the Atlantic Ocean in beautiful South Florida. We are home to both luxurious and quaint neighborhoods, major corporations, and many recreational amenities in the water and on the land. We have a diverse population that is welcoming to everyone. Our infrastructure is modern and we use contemporary planning and operational practices that enable us to keep taxes competitively low and our property values stable. We are a nautical destination for saltwater and freshwater enthusiasts. We are home to some of the best and most consistent surf in South Florida. There are two large surfing areas on our beach. We host several Eastern Surfing Association and other ocean sports competitions. Our beach is the birthplace of the Surfers for Autism organization. The surf industry is alive and well with Island Water Sports, Billabong Surf Shop and even a surfboard manufacturer, the legendary Bird Surfboards. If you enjoy paddle boarding and kayaking then this is the place to paddle. For boaters, we are within a mile of two ocean inlets (Boca Raton and the well-known Lighthouse Point). Our off-shore reefs and marine life are abundant and easily accessible. There is a variety of housing options with deep-water access. Quiet Waters Park features canoe rentals and the only local cable water ski attraction, the Ski Rixen. It also has a large mountain bike trail for the landlubbers. Hands down, our oceanfront hotels offer the best views, rooms, and distance to shopping, dining and regional professional sports teams such as the Miami Heat, Miami Dolphins, and Florida Panthers. Many spectators stay at our hotels when attending the Orange Bowl and other major sports venues. Our Parks and Recreation facilities and programs are some of the best in the area. We feature several programs, activities, and athletics for children and adults of all ages. Our Aquatics Center draws major university swim teams from all over the country for winter practice. During the rest of the year, we have a winning competitive swim team and swim lessons for the young and old. We also have two boat launch ramps. One is for ocean access. The other is for Everglades National Park access. Each year we host several special events including the Founder’s Day at the Beach, Arts Festival, MLK Day Parade, and Carnival, Winter Wonderland, and the spectacular fireworks on the 4th of July at the International Fishing Pier. Our 960 feet International Fishing Pier is an award-winning facility that is the model for other piers on the Atlantic Ocean in Florida. It features a 24-hour oceanfront restaurant, roof-top terrace, and full-service bait and tackle shop. Our location within 30 minutes of 2 international airports and 2 seaports, major roadways, and an educated populace makes Deerfield Beach a unique opportunity for businesses seeking a prosperous and sub-tropical location. We are home to JM Family Enterprises/Southeast Toyota, People’s Trust Insurance, Just Play Toys, SHL Pharmaceuticals, and a range of office and industrial parks. We also have a partnership with Florida Atlantic University Research and Development Agency that created a research park along Interstate 95. Please visit our partner, the Greater Deerfield Beach Chamber of Commerce for all the details about our business environment and local interests. We invite you to visit our vibrant coastal community that features beautiful vistas, fun activities, great dining, and entertainment. We offer all of this and more. I look forward to your visit or relocation to the best beach and city in Broward County. Special Events Application | Deerfield Beach, FL - Official Website Skip to Main Content Search Centennial Business Departments Residents Government Visitors Home Departments Parks & Recreation Special Events Special Events Application A A Special Events Application Each year the City of Deerfield Beach is the site of an ever-growing number of special events. These events can help highlight your organization, help fundraise and bring awareness, and help bring the community together. We are committed to supporting quality special events throughout our community. In order for each event to take place, the City has established an application process along with a set of guidelines that must be followed to ensure the safety and success of your event. If you are unsure about the availability of a venue or have a question regarding a possible event, a preliminary conversation with City staff will help allow for a seamless planning experience. A Special Event in the City of Deerfield Beach is defined as any sale, grand opening, photoshoot, party, holiday celebration, bazaar, concert or other performance, fair, carnival, tent revival, fundraising event, art festival, race, tour, rally, parade, bicycle run, demonstration, contest, exhibition, block party, outdoor display or similar event or occurrence, including the use of tents, or other devices or structures to conduct, advertise or promote any such event occurring on public or non-public lands or in a public right-of-way such as a public or non-public street, shared-use path, alley or other public place or building, park, beach, parking lot, vacant lot, where the event would substantially inhibit the usual flow of pedestrian or vehicular travel or which occupies any public area or building so as to preempt use of the said area by the general public for its intended use or which deviates from the established use of said area or building. APPLICATION DETAILS Below are some questions to help you identify the steps you will need to take through the application process. Do you need to fill out a special event application? Yes - if, defined as any gathering of 20 people or more in a public place, sale, grand opening, photoshoot, party, holiday celebration, bazaar, concert or other performance, fair, carnival, tent revival, fundraising event, art festival, race, tour, rally, parade, bicycle run, demonstration, contest, exhibition, block party, outdoor display or similar event or occurrence, including the use of tents, or other devices or structures to conduct, advertise or promote any such event occurring on public or non-public lands or in a public right-of-way such as a public or non-public street, shared-use path, alley or other public place or building, park, beach, parking lot, vacant lot, where the event would substantially inhibit the usual flow of pedestrian or vehicular travel or which occupies any public area or building so as to preempt use of a said area by the general public for its intended use or which deviates from the established use of said area or building. Yes if; Gatherings of 20 people or more in a public place Sale of alcoholic beverages Use of mechanical or inflatable rides Amplified music/entertainment, Parking Lot/Road Closure, Construction/Assembly of temporary structures. Yes if, renting a facility or pavilion and bringing additional equipment to the location including a third-party vendor, cooking equipment, and/or alcohol. Water Utility Billing | Deerfield Beach, FL - Official Website Skip to Main Content Search Centennial Business Departments Residents Government Visitors Home Departments Water Utility Billing A A Water Utility Billing AMI INFORMATION Advanced Metering Infrastructure PAYMENT OPTIONS NEW ACCOUNT CLOSE ACCOUNT UPDATE MAILING ADDRESS FORMS & APPLICATIONS CONSERVATION & REBATES Payment Options Mail to: City of Deerfield Beach, PO Box 947631, Atlanta, GA 30394-7631 (include a coupon with check/money order) Pay Online Automatic fund transfer using a checking account or debit/credit card Financial institution's bill pay service Dropbox at City Hall (located by the picnic tables) In-person at City Hall's cashier window BACK TO TOP New Account To establish a new account, the property owner or tenant can submit the required documents below via email or bring them in person to the Water Utility Department at City Hall. Application for Service , completed and signed by owner or tenant Copy of Closing Statement (if owner) or lease (if tenant), signed Driver's License or State/government-issued picture ID Security Deposit (call for the deposit amount as it is based on the meter size; starts at $185.00; deposit must be paid prior to service commencement) If a commercial property will be occupied, proof that the Certificate of Use was either applied for or issued is required BACK TO TOP Closing an Existing Account To close an existing account, the account holder must provide written notice using any of the following options.  Please be sure to include the account number, service termination date, and the forwarding mailing address. Termination of Account Form , completed and signed by the account holder Email Customer Service Mail to: Water Utility Billing, City of Deerfield Beach, 150 NE 2nd Ave, Deerfield Beach FL 33441 In-person at City Hall by completing the Termination of Account Form Fax to 954-250-4113 Update Mailing Address To update a mailing address requires written notice by emailing our Customer Service , or by mail, fax, or in-person to the Water Utility Department. BACK TO TOP Forms & Applications Application for Service Autopay Using Checking Account/Debit or Credit Card (sign up here after you log in) Request for Extension Letter/Appeal Notice Termination of Existing Account BACK TO TOP Conservation Pays The City of Deerfield Beach has been supporting water conservation efforts for years but believes now is the perfect time to encourage its water customers to make conservation a priority. We are offering rebates and free water-conserving devices to encourage you to make water conservation a priority. Learn more regarding the conservation pays program and rebate incentives . We are also providing free, low-flow water faucet aerators and showerheads to residential customers. You must bring us your old showerhead in order to receive a new showerhead; however, you do not need to bring us your old aerators. We are also offering pre-rinse spray valves to commercial businesses. The showerheads and aerators may be picked up at the Utilities Maintenance Division located at 200 Goolsby Boulevard. Irrigation Rebates Want to upgrade your home irrigation system? Broward County now offers rebates for the installation of EPA WaterSense-labeled smart irrigation controllers and pressure regulating spray bodies. Broward County residents who have the intended goal of upgrading their inefficient sprinkler systems with EPA Watersense®-labeled weather-based timers and pressure regulating spray sprinkler bodies can now do so and receive a rebate! Learn more about Irrigation Rebates.
